lib/hope/concurrency/spin_lock.h

00002  * You may use, distribute and modify this code under the

00006  * this file. If not, please write to: bezborodoff.gleb@gmail.com, or visit : https://github.com/glensand/hope
00007  */
00008 
00009 #pragma once
00010 
00011 #include <atomic>
00012 
00013 #undef mm_pause
00014 #if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
00015 #   include <immintrin.h>
00016 #   define mm_pause _mm_pause()
00017 #else
00018 #   define mm_pause
00019 #endif
00020 
00021 namespace hope::concurrency{
00022 
00023     class spin_lock {
00024 
00025     public:
00026         spin_lock() = default;
00027         ~spin_lock() = default;
00028 
00029         void lock() noexcept {
00030             for (;;) {
00031                 // Optimistically assume the lock is free on the first try
00032                 if (!m_lock.exchange(true, std::memory_order_acquire)) {
00033                     return;
00034                 }
00035                 // Wait for lock to be released without generating cache misses
00036                 while (m_lock.load(std::memory_order_relaxed)) {
00037                     // Issue X86 PAUSE or ARM YIELD instruction to reduce contention between
00038                     // hyper-threads
00039                     mm_pause;
00040                 }
00041             }
00042         }
00043 
00044         bool try_lock() noexcept {
00045             // First do a relaxed load to check if lock is free in order to prevent
00046             // unnecessary cache misses if someone does while(!try_lock())
00047             return !m_lock.load(std::memory_order_relaxed) &&
00048                 !m_lock.exchange(true, std::memory_order_acquire);
00049         }
00050 
00051         void unlock() noexcept {
00052             m_lock.store(false, std::memory_order_release);
00053         }
00054 
00055     private:
00056         std::atomic_bool m_lock = { false };
00057     };
00058     
00059 }
